title: Samrean
author: Samrean
content: I have been observing few accounts in the local thread who are playing intelligently to get merits by posting tweets pics and text in order to get merit in WO and also distribute too much merits between them.The Accounts suspected areHamza2424WatCheThemePenZAINmalik75Â Previously i reported Possible Merit Abuse in local board and later NoorulHuda was banned and Cosmic Beyonders got negative trust and account stops posting but their tactics were same.The game plan is to post tweets from famous twitter accounts in WO (its a copy past with zero effort plus they give source link to make the safe) and get merits. Also they distribute merits between each other in local thread too much and with some planning all of them are reaching Full member. Recently the exchange of merits is too much. Â Previously NoorulHuda and Cosmic Beyonders were doing same and people pointed out too. (https://bitcointalk.org/index.php?topic=178336.msg59852248#msg59852248)Check the post history especially for suspected accounts and you will find too many tweets spams with no real effort to write anything themselves and too get the merits. Also you will find their post one after the other in WO. Â Also check the images they use of full scale pics only to spam in the WO. Let's see if they try to edit their post after seeing this threads.Anyways sharing my observations which was noticing for a long time.

comments.created_time: August 14, 2022, 11:58:07 AMLast edit: August 14, 2022, 12:34:28 PM by dragonvslinux
comments.body: Personally I care much more about the value of posts, than the intent on posting, even if I do bare the OP's opinion in my mind and therefore sometimes I don't send merit because of this (WatChe comes to mind).For example one of those users mentioned - Hamza2424 - I have sent merit a handful of times for charts mainly regurgitated from twitter. This for me is useful/vauable as I don't spend much time on twitter looking at charts or analysis, so WO helps to refine this process for me with other users posting what they consider to be the most relevant. As long as it has a source, I don't see any issue with that, and it remains useful for me.Is it a very lazy form of posting, without adding much additional opinion yourself? For sure, and that's why I usually don't give more than +1 if the analysis isn't original. But doesn't make it less useful personally.A few examples: 1 | 2 | 3 | 4. Note I'm also not the only one who finds these types of posts useful, or with value.Quote from: _BlackStar on August 14, 2022, 07:56:34 AMSo far I think WO is an easier place for spammers to get merit without putting too much effort into improving the quality of their posts. They can post memes, some words or whatever just to get merit, but I'm not generalizing all users there are the same. It's just about some users who aren't really sincere about having a good discussion about bitcoin.Could someone explain the difference (in terms of value) of a hat-wearing WO member regurgitating a chart or meme from twitter and getting 5-20 merits for it, compared to some newbie or low ranking member getting 1-4? Obviously the intent from WO regulars is rarely to gain merit (as most have enough), but I don't see how the post value is any different. Double standards come to mind here.If others want to be "more careful" with who they send merit to, then you are more than welcome. Personally I'll merit what I find useful or of value to me, because I'm meriting a post not a user.

comments.body: Quote from: Hamza2424 on August 14, 2022, 12:47:48 PMQuote from: LoyceV on August 14, 2022, 12:38:07 PMQuote from: dragonvslinux on August 14, 2022, 11:58:07 AMPersonally I care much more about the value of posts, than the intent on postingValid point. I don't even mind seeing valuable posts from Twitter here, because I don't use Twitter (and my computer can't even access it).What is wrong in meriting my Community members with good posts.I don't see a problem with it, as long as they aren't shit posts or sockpuppets and generally I'd encourage it. Personally this is how I see merit distribution is intended; from merit sources -> high merit earning individuals -> lower merit earning users and to local community boards. Ideally merit sources would have infinite amount of time in order to merit lower merited individuals and newbies, but this is unrealistic. Other members obviously have different opinions and prefer more of a gate-keeping strategy in order to avoid merit ending up "in the wrong hands". This is predominantly due to DT1 eligibility being based on trust from merit earning individuals, so merit abuse becomes an issue. Despite being a relevant concern the root problem imo is with the system of DT1 eligibility, rather than merit distribution itself.
